title: Hugh Jackman ends Wolverine diet with HUGE bowl of pasta | Daily Mail Online
text: Share 140 shares During the interview with the American late-night host, Hugh was treated to a special surprise by American chef Mario Francesco Batali. Host Jimmy Fallon prompted the chef to bring out an oversized bowl of pasta to his desk after announcing: 'Since the final Wolverine movie is coming out next week, It's time for Wolverine to break his fast.' 'It's time for Wolverine to break his fast': Host Jimmy Fallon helped the actor with his first mouthful of pasta, which they then followed with a glass of vino Hugh couldn't contain his excitement as he danced and cheered, before adding: 'That is the greatest thing I've seen in my life. Epic. Yes!' In front of the studio audience, Hugh didn't hesitate in digging in then and there, cheerfully stating 'this is so good' with a large grin on his face. Jimmy helped the star with his first mouthful, which they then followed by clinking their glasses of vino together as a cheers. 'This is SO good': Hugh didn't hesitate in digging in then and there, cheerfully praising the dish with a large grin on his face The actor later took to Instagram with the bowl of pasta firmly in his hands in his dressing room. He captioned the image, in part: 'Happy break the Wolverine diet!' Earlier in the show the pair played a hilarious round of the Whisper Game, in which they both laughed off their failed attempts. He's a FAN! Hugh couldn't contain his excitement as he danced and cheered as the dish was brought out and claimed it was 'epic' while shoveling the carb-loaded dinner into his mouth 'Happy break the Wolverine diet!' Hugh later showcased he was enjoying the massive dish from the comforts of his dressing room backstage Having recently undergone surgery to remove cancerous cells from his nose, the actor displayed a lighter-toned bandage on his right nostrils. Hugh was dressed in a tailored blue suit jacket and coordinating pants over his athletic frame, which he teamed with a crisp white button-up shirt and purple tie. Suave star!
